column2: Swords have been sharpened and oaths sworn. My fellow faction members assure me that they are ready for war. The time to win our independence is finally here.
column3: Les épées ont été affutées et les serments prononcés. Mes compagnons de la faction m'assurent qu'ils sont prêts pour la guerre. Le temps de l'indépendance est enfin arrivé!
column4: Schwerter wurde geschärft und Eide geschworen. Meine Kolleginnen und Splittergruppesmitglieder versichern mir dass sie bereit für den Krieg sind. Die Zeit unsere Unabhängigkeit zu gewinnen, ist endlich da.
column6: Swords have been sharpened and oaths sworn. My fellow faction members assure me that they are ready for war. The time to win our independence is finally here.

column2: We started early, the sun had barely risen above the horizon. There was plenty of prey, the dogs caught many rabbits and I slayed one great boar before he killed my horse and myself.
column3: Nous avons commencé tôt, le soleil venait à peine de percer l'horizon. Les proies abondaient, les chiens ont pris de nombreux lapins et j'ai occis un sanglier avant qu'il ne tue mon cheval et moi-même.
column4: Wir fingen früh an, die Sonne hatte sich über dem Horizont kaum erhoben. Es gab viel Beute, die Hunde fingen viele Kaninchen und ich tötete einen großen Eber, bevor er mein Pferd und mich selbst tötete.
column6: We started early, the sun had barely risen above the horizon. There was plenty of prey, the dogs caught many rabbits and I slayed one great boar before he killed my horse and myself.

column2: The new bird is almost too perfect. I enjoy every hunt with her, and the cook has trouble finding new recipes for rabbit.
column3: Le nouvel oiseau est presque trop parfait. J'éprouve une grande joie à chaque chasse avec lui et le cuisinier à du mal à trouver de nouveaux récipients pour conserver les lapins.
column4: Der neue Vogel ist fast zu vollkommen. Ich genieße jede Jagd mit ihm, und der Koch hat Schwierigkeiten, neue Rezepte für das Kaninchen zu finden.
column6: The new bird is almost too perfect. I enjoy every hunt with her, and the cook has trouble finding new recipes for rabbit.

column2: I'm never happier than when I'm in my study, poring over some newly imported volume. Books are truly God's greatest gift to man.
column3: Je ne suis jamais aussi heureux que lorsque je suis à mon étude, étudiant de près quelques nouveaux manuscrits importés. Les livres sont vraiment les plus cadeaux que Dieu à fait aux hommes.
column4: Ich bin nie glücklicher wenn ich über einem kürzlich importierten Buch brüte. Bücher sind wahrhaft das größte Geschenk Gottes, des Allmächtigen.
column6: I'm never happier than when I'm in my study, poring over some newly imported volume. Books are truly God's greatest gift to man.

column2: I found the strange book collecting dust in a forgotten corner of the castle library. It took me several weeks of intense study before its mystery revealed itself to me. The gibberish parts was encoded and after many hours trying to decipher I managed to break it and construct a key to make it easier for me to read. Its mystery is still not solved...
column3: J'ai trouvé ce livre poussiéreux dans un coin perdu de la bibliothèque du château. Cela m'a pris plusieurs semaines d'intenses études avant que je puisse percer son mystère. Les parties pleines de charabia étaient en réalité codées. Après maintes heures et tentatives pour les déchiffrer j'ai réussi à m'en défaire et à fabriquer une clé me permettant de lire plus facilement. Son mystère n'est toujours pas résolu....
column4: Ich fand das fremde Buch, das Staub an einer vergessenen Ecke der Schlossbibliothek sammelt. Ich brauchte mehrere Wochen der intensiven Studie, bevor sein Mysterium sich zu mir offenbarte. Die Kauderwelsch-Teile wurden verschlüsselt und nach vielen Stunden versuchend zu entziffern ich schaffte, es zu brechen und einen Schlüssel zu bauen, es leichter für mich zu machen, zu lesen. Sein Mysterium wird noch immer nicht gelöst...
column6: I found the strange book collecting dust in a forgotten corner of the castle library. It took me several weeks of intense study before its mystery revealed itself to me. The gibberish parts was encoded and after many hours trying to decipher I managed to break it and construct a key to make it easier for me to read. Its mystery is still not solved...

column2: My regular excursions into the dungeon have only served to whet my appetite. I have sent for a skilled torturer who will teach me more about the arts of pain.
column3: Mes excursions régulières dans le donjon ont seulement servies à aiguiser mon appétit. J'ai envoyé chercher un bourreau talentueux qui m'en apprendra plus sur l'art de la douleur.
column4: Meine regelmäßigen Ausflüge in den Kerker haben nur meinem Verlangen nach mehr gedient. Ich habe nach einem Fachpeiniger geschickt, der mich mehr über die Künste des Schmerzes lehren wird.
column6: My regular excursions into the dungeon have only served to whet my appetite. I have sent for a skilled torturer who will teach me more about the arts of pain.

column2: My garden is the apple of my eye, my pride and joy. I distrust my gardener and would spend every hour of the day in my garden if I could.
column3: Mon jardin est la prune de mes yeux, ma fierté et ma joie. Je me méfie de mon jardinier et passerais ma vie dans mon jardin si je pouvais.
column4: Mein Garten ist wie mein Augapfel, mein Stolz und meine Heiterkeit. Ich misstraue meinem Gärtner und würde jede Stunde des Tages in meinem Garten verbringen, wenn ich könnte.
column6: My garden is the apple of my eye, my pride and joy. I distrust my gardener and would spend every hour of the day in my garden if I could.

column2: My modest attempts to write poetry were never meant to be published in any way, but wherever I go, bards and minstrels are reciting or singing my poems.
column3: Mes modestes tentatives pour écrire de la poésie n'ont jamais été publiées, mais où que j'ailles, bardes et menestrels récitent mes poèmes.
column4: Meine bescheidenen Versuche, Gedichte zu schreiben, waren nie dazu gedacht veröffentlicht zu werden, aber wohin auch immer ich gehe, rezitieren Barden und Minnesänger  meine Gedichte
column6: My modest attempts to write poetry were never meant to be published in any way, but wherever I go, bards and minstrels are reciting or singing my poems.

column2: After a long time of contemplation and soul-searching it feels as if I could bear to live in complete celibacy for the rest of my life.
column3: Après un long moment de contemplation et de retour sur moi-même il semble que je puisse vivre dans un célibat complet jusqu'à la fin de mes jours.
column4: Nach einer langen Zeit des Nachdenkens und der Gewissenserforschung fühlt es sich, als ob ich die Last des Zölibat den Rest meines Lebens ertragen könnte.
column6: After a long time of contemplation and soul-searching it feels as if I could bear to live in complete celibacy for the rest of my life.

column2: This lifestyle of utmost pleasure and joyous life suits me perfectly. This can be nothing but heaven.
column3: Ce mode de vie plein de plaisirs extrêmes et et de joie de vivre me convient parfaitement. Ce ne peut être rien d'autre que le paradis.
column4: Dieser Lebensstil aud purem Vergnügens und freudigen Lebens passt mir vollkommen. Das kann nur der Himmel sein.
column6: This lifestyle of utmost pleasure and joyous life suits me perfectly. This can be nothing but heaven.

column2: The duel was close fought, but in the end I was victorious over my opponent. As I basked in the admiration of my peers, I knew that I had to do this again.
column3: Le duel fut un combat serré et acharné, mais à la fin je parvins à triompher de mon adversaire. Après m'être enivré de l'admiration de mes pairs, j'ai su que je devais le refaire.
column4: Das Duell war knapp erkämpft, aber schließlich war ich über meinen Gegner siegreich. Als ich mich in der Bewunderung unter meine Gleichen sonnte, wusste ich, dass ich das wieder tun musste.
column6: The duel was close fought, but in the end I was victorious over my opponent. As I basked in the admiration of my peers, I knew that I had to do this again.

column2: I have finally become an expert in Islamic jurisprudence! My knowledge of the Qur'an, the Sunnah, Ijma' (Consensus) and Qiyas (Analogy) is what makes me a faqih and I will use that knowledge to be a better [Root.GetTitle] and ruler of my people.
column3: Je suis enfin devenu un expert en jurisprudence islamique ! Ma connaissance du Coran, de la sunna, de l’ijmâ‘ (le consensus) et de la qiyâs (l’analogie) font de moi un faqîh. J’emploierais mon savoir pour devenir un meilleur [Root.GetTitle] et guide pour mon peuple.
column4: Ich bin endlich ein Experte des islamischen Rechts! Mein Wissen um den Qur'an, die Sunna, Idschma (Konsens) und Qiyas (Analogie) macht mich zu einem Faqih und ich werde dieses Wissen nutzen, um ein besserer [Root.GetTitle] und Herrscher zu sein.
column6: ¡Ya soy un experto en jurisprudencia Islámica! Mis conocimientos del Corán, la Sunna, la Ijma (Consenso) y el Qiyas (Analogía) es lo que me hace un faquí y usaré esos conocimientos para ser un mejor [Root.GetTitle] y gobernante para mi pueblo.

column2: During a mission to try and fabricate a claim to a title, my [Root.GetChancellorName] has been murdered!
column3: Au cours d’une mission visant à essayer de fabriquer une revendication sur un titre, mon Chancelier [Root.GetChancellorName]a été tué !
column4: Während einer Mission, auf der er versuchte, einen Anspruch auf einen Titel zu fingieren, wurde mein [Root.GetChancellorName] ermordet!
column6: ¡Asesinaron a mi [Root.GetChancellorName], que intentaba falsificar un alegato contra un título!

column2: Someone has been spreading lies about me to my vassals, saying that I distrust them and am unfit to rule. Unforunately it seems my vassals are receptive to this slander, and my relations with them have been damaged.
column3: Quelqu'un a été répandre des mensonges à mon sujet auprès de mes vassaux, disant que je manque de confiance a leur égard et que je suis inapte à gouverner. Malheureusement, il semble que mes vassaux soient réceptifs à ces calomnies, et mes relations avec eux ont été détériorées.
column4: Irgendjemand hat Lügen über mich verbreitet . Meine Vasallen, glauben, dass ich sie Misstrauen und bin unfähig zu herrschen. Leider scheint es meine Vasallen sind empfänglich für diese Verleumdung, und meine Beziehungen mit ihnen sind beschädigt worden.
column6: Someone has been spreading lies about me to my vassals, saying that I distrust them and am unfit to rule. Unforunately it seems my vassals are receptive to this slander, and my relations with them have been damaged.

column2:
My liege, I have managed to sow distrust between [From.GetTitledName] and [From.GetHerHis] vassals. I hope this pleases you.

Your humble [Root.GetChancellorName],
[Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledName]
column3:
Mon seigneur, j'ai réussi à semer la discorde entre [From.GetTitledName] et ses vassaux. J'espère que cela vous plaira.

Votre humble Chancelier [Root.GetChancellorName],
[Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledName]
column4:
Meine Herr, ich habe es geschafft, Misstrauen zwischen [From.GetTitledName] und [From.GetHerHis] Vasallen zu säen. Ich hoffe, dass das Ihnen gefällt.

Deinen bescheidenen [Root.GetChancellorName]
[Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledName]
column6:
My liege, I have managed to sow distrust between [From.GetTitledName] and [From.GetHerHis] vassals. I hope this pleases you.

Your humble [Root.GetChancellorName],
[Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledName]

column2: It seems that the [Root.GetChancellorName] of [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], has been hard at work in [From.Location.GetName] trying to spread unrest among my vassals.
column3: Il semble que le Chancelier [Root.GetChancellorName] de [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], a œuvré sans relache en [From.Location.GetName] pour y propager l'agitation parmi mes vassaux.
column4: Es scheint, dass der [Root.GetChancellorName] von [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName] sich hart an der Arbeit in [From.Location.GetName] Unruhe unter meine Vasallen zu verbreiten,
column6: It seems that the [Root.GetChancellorName] of [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledName], has been hard at work in [From.Location.GetName] trying to spread unrest among my vassals.

column2:
My lord, your [Root.GetChancellorName] [FromFrom.GetTitledName] tried to encourage my vassals to turn against me! This shameless act can not go unpunished and to stop further interference I have thus decided to imprison your [Root.GetChancellorName] for an indefinite period of time.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
Seigneur, Votre Chancelier [Root.GetChancellorName] [FromFrom.GetTitledName] a essayé d'encourager mes vassaux à se retourner contre moi ! Cet acte abject ne peut rester impuni et pour empêcher toute nouvelle ingérence, j'ai décidé de l'emprisonner  pour une période indéfinie. 

Signé,
[From.GetTitledName]
column4:
Mein Herr, dein [Root.GetChancellorName] [FromFrom.GetTitledName] versuchte, meine Vasallen gegen mich zu wenden! Diese schamlose Akt kann nicht ungestraft bleiben und um weitere Störungen zu vermeiden habe ich so entschieden, Ihren [Root.GetChancellorName] für eine unbestimmte Zeit einzusperren.

Gezeichnet,
[From.GetTitledName]
column6:
My lord, your [Root.GetChancellorName] [FromFrom.GetTitledName] tried to encourage my vassals to turn against me! This shameless act can not go unpunished and to stop further interference I have thus decided to imprison your [Root.GetChancellorName] for an indefinite period of time.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2: [Root.GetTitledName], your Spymaster [From.GetTitledName] was killed by armed thugs when investigating a rumor about a plot.
column3: [Root.GetTitledName], votre Maître-Espion [From.GetTitledName] a été tué par des brutes armées alors qu’il enquêtait sur un possible complot.
column4: [Root.GetTitledName], Euer Agentenführer [From.GetTitledName] wurde von Schurken getötet, als er ein Gerücht über eine Verschwörung untersuchen wollte.
column6: [Root.GetTitledName], una panda de matones armados ha asesinado al jefe de espías [From.GetTitledName] cuando investigaba los rumores de complot.

column2: To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nI am shocked and appalled to hear of the rebellion of the treacherous [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]. My forces are of course at your disposal, but as the just and benevolent [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] that I know you to be, I am certain that you will not mind first settling the small territorial dispute that exists between us so that we may stand united on the battlefield, untroubled by such trifling matters.
column3: Pour [Root.GetTitledFirstName] de la part de [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nJe suis choqué et consterné par la rébellion des perfides [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]. Mes forces sont bien sûr à votre disposition et dans votre infinie bonté j’espère  que vous ne me tiendrez pas rigueur du léger diffèrent territorial qui nous oppose.  Que nous pourrons ainsi être unis sur le champ de bataille sans être troublé par ces broutilles, pour le bien du royaume.
column4: To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nI am shocked and appalled to hear of the rebellion of the treacherous [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]. My forces are of course at your disposal, but as the just and benevolent [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] that I know you to be, I am certain that you will not mind first settling the small territorial dispute that exists between us so that we may stand united on the battlefield, untroubled by such trifling matters.
column6: To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nI am shocked and appalled to hear of the rebellion of the treacherous [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]. My forces are of course at your disposal, but as the just and benevolent [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] that I know you to be, I am certain that you will not mind first settling the small territorial dispute that exists between us so that we may stand united on the battlefield, untroubled by such trifling matters.

column2: To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nI accept your outrageous demands, but know that your treacherous opportunism in my time of need will not be forgotten.
column3: Pour [Root.GetTitledFirstName] de la part de [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nJ'accepte vos exigences scandaleuses, mais sachez que votre opportunisme ne sera pas oublié et qu'un jour il faudra répondre de cette traîtrise.
column4: To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nI accept your outrageous demands, but know that your treacherous opportunism in my time of need will not be forgotten.
column6: To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nI accept your outrageous demands, but know that your treacherous opportunism in my time of need will not be forgotten.

column2: To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nI refuse to bow to your veiled threats. You have no rights to the title you claim, and if you choose to side with the rebels you will hang with all the other traitors.
column3: Pour [Root.GetTitledFirstName] de la part de [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nJe refuse de me plier à votre chantage. Vous n'avez pas droit au titre que vous revendiquez, et si vous choisissez de prendre parti pour les rebelles vous mourrez avec tous les autres traîtres.
column4: To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nI refuse to bow to your veiled threats. You have no rights to the title you claim, and if you choose to side with the rebels you will hang with all the other traitors.
column6: To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nI refuse to bow to your veiled threats. You have no rights to the title you claim, and if you choose to side with the rebels you will hang with all the other traitors.

column2: [From.GetTitledName] has taken advantage of the chaos of the civil war to declare independence.
column3: [From.GetTitledName] a profité du chaos de la guerre civile pour déclarer son indépendance.
column4: [From.GetTitledName] has taken advantage of the chaos of the civil war to declare independence.
column6: [From.GetTitledName] has taken advantage of the chaos of the civil war to declare independence.

column2: I have decided to break my vassal contract with [From.GetTitledName] and make [From.GetHerHim] independent.
column3: J'ai décidé de rompre mon contrat de vassalité concernant le titre de [From.GetTitledName] et de lui donner l'indépendance.
column4: Ich habe mich dazu beschlossen, meinen Vasallenvertrag mit [From.GetTitledName] zu brechen und [From.GetHerHim] unabhängig machen.
column6: I have decided to break my vassal contract with [From.GetTitledName] and make [From.GetHerHim] independent.

column2: Upholding the virtue of Charity means to bear wrongs patiently. There are some people who dislike me personally and wish me bad luck, but I forgive them.
column3: Faire preuve de charité signifie aussi de prendre sur soi. Il y a des gens qui me détestent personnellement et souhaite ma chute, mais je leur pardonne.
column4: Upholding the virtue of Charity means to bear wrongs patiently. There are some people who dislike me personally and wish me bad luck, but I forgive them.
column6: Upholding the virtue of Charity means to bear wrongs patiently. There are some people who dislike me personally and wish me bad luck, but I forgive them.

column2: With the help of the local aldermen, I have implemented new and improved farming techniques in [Root.Location.GetName].
column3: Avec l'aide des conseillers municipaux locaux, J'ai mis en place de nouvelles techniques agricoles en [Root.Location.GetName].
column4: Mit Hilfe des einheimischen Stadtrates, habe ich neue und verbesserte Anbaumethoden in [Root.Location.GetName] implementiert.
column6: With the help of the local aldermen, I have implemented new and improved farming techniques in [Root.Location.GetName].

column2: My liege, I bring good news from the province of [From.Location.GetName]. In my research, I have come across new farming techniques which would increase the crop yield of the peasants' fields. With the help of the local aldermen, these techniques have now been implemented across the province.
column3: Mon seigneur, je vous apporte de bonnes nouvelles de la province de [From.Location.GetName]. Dans mes recherches, je suis tombé sur de nouvelles techniques agricoles qui augmentent le rendement des champs. Avec l'aide des conseillers municipaux locaux, ces techniques ont été mises en œuvre dans toute la province.
column4: Mein Lehnsherr, ich bringe gute Nachrichten aus der Provinz [From.Location.GetName]. Bei meinen Forschungen bin ich über neue landwirtschaftliche Techniken gestolpert, die den Ernteertrag der Felder erhöhen würden. Mit Hilfe der einheimischen Stadträte haben sie diese Techniken jetzt in den ganzen Provinz durchgesetzt.
column6: My liege, I bring good news from the province of [From.Location.GetName]. In my research, I have come across new farming techniques which would increase the crop yield of the peasants' fields. With the help of the local aldermen, these techniques have now been implemented across the province.

column2: My efforts to improve the economy of [From.Location.GetName] have been hindered by peasant obstructionism. They are up in arms for what they believe to be a scheme to raise their taxes!
column3: Mes efforts pour améliorer l'économie de [From.Location.GetName] ont été entravés par l'obstruction des paysans. Ils ont pris les armes pour ce qu'ils croient être un stratagème pour augmenter leurs impôts!
column4: Meine Bemühungen, die Wirtschaft von [From.Location.GetName] zu verbessern wurden von bäuerliche Obstruktionismus behindert. Sie sind verärgert weil sie glauben es ist ein Plan um ihre Steuern zu erheben!
column6: My efforts to improve the economy of [From.Location.GetName] have been hindered by peasant obstructionism. They are up in arms for what they believe to be a scheme to raise their taxes!

column2: My liege, I regret that I must be the bearer of ill news. In my research, I have come across new farming techniques which would increase the crop yield of the peasants' fields. Despite the best of intentions, my attempts to implement these techiques have been met with suspicion and hostility from the local peasants, who are up in arms for what they believe to be a scheme to raise their taxes.
column3: Mon seigneur, je regrette d'être le porteur de mauvaises nouvelles. Dans mes recherches, je suis tombé sur de nouvelles techniques agricoles qui augmentent le rendement des récoltes. Malgré les meilleures intentions du monde, mes tentatives pour mettre en œuvre ces techiques ont été accueillies avec suspicion et l'hostilité des paysans locaux pensant que nous cherchions à augmenter leurs impôts.
column4: Mein Lehnsherr, ich bedauere, dass ich der Überbringer schlechter Nachrichten sein muss. Bei meinen Forschungen bin ich über neue landwirtschaftliche Techniken gestolpert, die den Ernteertrag der Felder erhöhen würden. Trotz der besten Absichten, wurden meine Versuche, diese Techniken umzusetzen, mit Misstrauen und Feindseligkeit von den örtlichen Bauern betrachtet. Sie sind verärgert, weil sie glauben, es ist ein Plan, um ihre Steuern zu erhöhen!
column6: My liege, I regret that I must be the bearer of ill news. In my research, I have come across new farming techniques which would increase the crop yield of the peasants' fields. Despite the best of intentions, my attempts to implement these techiques have been met with suspicion and hostility from the local peasants, who are up in arms for what they believe to be a scheme to raise their taxes.

column2: Today, my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] asked me for landed estates to live off...
column3: Aujourd'hui, mon [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] m'a demandé la permission de quitter de château familiale et souhaiterai que je lui accorde un domaine ..
column4: Heute hat mein [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] mich dazu gebittet [From.GetHerHim] Grundbesitz zu geben um davon zu Leben...
column6: Today, my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] asked me for landed estates to live off...

column2: Even in death, I cannot escape the moneylenders!
column3: Même dans la mort, je ne peux pas échapper aux usuriers!
column4: Selbst im Tode kann ich den Geldverleihern nicht entkommen!
column6: Even in death, I cannot escape the moneylenders!

column2: The moneylenders are here, seeking repayment for [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s debts.
column3: Les prêteurs sont là, ils veulent obtenir le remboursement des dettes de [From.GetTitledFirstName].
column4: Die Geldverleiher sind gekommen um die Rückzahlung von [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s Kredit zu fordern.
column6: The moneylenders are here, seeking repayment for [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s debts.

column2: The moneylenders are here, reminding me of that loan I took...
column3: Les prêteurs sont là pour me rappeler que j’ai un emprunt à rembourser...
column4: Die Geldverleiher sind hier und erinnern mich an mein Darlehen ...
column6: Los prestamistas me recuerdan la deuda que asumí...

column2: I have been possessed by some divine power, though I know not whether it is good or evil. It speaks to me, voices inside of my head that those around me cannot hear.
column3: J'ai été possédé par une certaine puissance divine, bien que je ne sache pas si elle est bienveillante ou maléfique. Elle me parle, une petite voix à l'intérieur de ma tête que ceux qui sont autour de moi ne peuvent pas entendre.
column4: Ich werde von einen göttlichen Macht besessen, obwohl ich weiß nicht, ob es gut oder böse ist. Sie spricht zu mir, Stimmen in meinem Kopf, dass diejenigen um mich nicht hören können.
column6: I have been possessed by some divine power, though I know not whether it is good or evil. It speaks to me, voices inside of my head that those around me cannot hear.

column2: The Order of Brothers of the German House of Saint Mary in Jerusalem has been formed, sponsored by [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] and the Holy Roman Emperor. The Teutonic Order, much like the Knights of St. John and the Knights Templar, primarily protect and care for pilgrims to the Holy Land, but will serve any good Catholic ruler willing to pay for their upkeep. Being a religious order, they will only fight against heretics and infidels.
column3: L’ordre des frères de la maison germanique de Sainte-Marie à Jérusalem a été formé, parrainé par [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] et par l’empereur romain germanique. Tout comme le font les chevaliers de St-Jean et les chevaliers templiers, l’ordre teutonique s’occupe principalement des pèlerins venant en Terre Sainte et les protège, mais ses membres serviront également tout souverain catholique prêt à payer pour leurs services. En tant qu’ordre religieux, ils ne combattront que les hérétiques et les infidèles.
column4: Der Orden der Brüder vom deutschen Haus Sankt Mariens in Jerusalem wurde mit der Unterstützung von [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] und des Heiligen Römischen Kaisers gegründet. Der Teutonische Orden beschützt, ähnlich wie die Ritter von St. John und den Tempelrittern, die Pilger zum Heiligen Land, wird aber jedem guten, katholischen Herrscher dienen der bereit ist, ihren Unterhalt zu zahlen. Als religiöser Orden kämpfen sie nur gegen Ketzer und Ungläubige.
column6: La Orden de los Hermanos de la Casa Alemana de Santa María en Jerusalén se ha formado, patrocinada por [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] y el Santo Emperador Romano. La Orden Teutónica, al igual que los Caballeros de San Juan y los Caballeros Templarios, principalmente protegen y cuidan a los peregrinos a Tierra Santa, pero servirán a cualquier buen gobernante Católico dispuesto a pagar por su mantenimiento. Siendo una orden religiosa, sólo lucharán contra los herejes e infieles.

column2: The Order of Santiago has been formed, sponsored by [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] and the Kings of Spain. The Order of Santiago will serve any good Catholic ruler willing to pay for their upkeep. Being a religious order, they will not fight other Catholics.
column3: L'Ordre de Santiago a été formé, soutenu par [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] et le Roi d'Espagne. L'Ordre de Santiago servira tout bon souverain catholique voulant bien les entretenir. Etant un Ordre religieux, ils ne se battront pas contre d'autres catholiques.
column4: Der Orden von Santiago wurde durch [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] und die Könige Spaniens gegründet. Der Orden von Santiago wird jedem guten katholischen Herscher dienen, dar bereit ist, für ihren Unterhalt zu zahlen. Eine religiöser Orden seiend, werden sie mit anderen Katholiken nicht kämpfen.
column6: The Order of Santiago has been formed, sponsored by [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] and the Kings of Spain. The Order of Santiago will serve any good Catholic ruler willing to pay for their upkeep. Being a religious order, they will not fight other Catholics.

column2: The Order of the Livonian Brothers of the Sword has been formed, sponsored by [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] and the Holy Roman Emperor. The Livonian Order will serve any good Catholic ruler willing to pay for their upkeep. Being a religious order, they will not fight other Catholics.
column3: L'Ordre des Chevaliers Teutoniques, Portes Glaives ou encore Fréres de l'Epée a été formé, soutenu par [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] et le Saint Empire Romain. L'Ordre Teutonique servira tout bon souverain catholique voulant bien les entretenir. Etant un Ordre religieux, ils ne se battront pas contre d'autres catholiques.
column4: Der Livonische Orden wurde durch [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] gegründet. Der Livonische Orden wird jedem guten katholischen Herscher dienen, dar bereit ist, für ihren Unterhalt zu zahlen. Eine religiöser Orden seiend, werden sie mit anderen Katholiken nicht kämpfen.
column6: The Order of the Livonian Brothers of the Sword has been formed, sponsored by [ThePope.GetTitledFirstName] and the Holy Roman Emperor. The Livonian Order will serve any good Catholic ruler willing to pay for their upkeep. Being a religious order, they will not fight other Catholics.

column2: The Holy Father has refused to lift the excommunication against me.
column3: Le Saint Père a refusé de lever mon excommunication.
column4: The Holy Father has refused to lift the excommunication against me.
column6: The Holy Father has refused to lift the excommunication against me.

column2: I have assembled the Electors of [From.GetName] to vote on my proposed Succession Law change.
column3: J'ai réuni les électeurs de [From.GetName] pour voter le changement du droit des successions proposé.
column4: Ich habe die Wähler von [From.GetName] versammelt, um über meine vorgeschlagene Erbfolgeänderung abzustimmen.
column6: I have assembled the Electors of [From.GetName] to vote on my proposed Succession Law change.

column2: I have decided to institute the Gavelkind Succession Law in the [From.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals.\n\nYour [From.Holder.GetTitle]
column3: J'ai décidé d'instituer le droit des successions du partage salique en [From.GetFullName]. Votre soutien et celui de mes autres fidèles vassaux m'est nécessaire.\n\nVotre [From.Holder.GetTitle]
column4: Ich habe beschlossen, das Erbteilungs-Nachfolgegesetz in [From.GetFullName] einzuführen. Alles was benötigt wird, ist die Unterstützung von Euch und der anderen treuen Vasallen.\n\n Euer [From.Holder.GetTitle]
column6: I have decided to institute the Gavelkind Succession Law in the [From.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals.\n\nYour [From.Holder.GetTitle]

column2: I have decided to institute the Primogeniture Succession Law in the [From.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals.\n\nYour [From.Holder.GetTitle]
column3: J'ai décidé d'instituer le droit de succession par la primogéniture en [From.GetFullName]. Votre soutien et celui de mes autres fidèles vassaux m'est nécessaire.\n\nVotre [From.Holder.GetTitle]
column4: Ich habe beschlossen, das Senioratserbrecht in [From.GetFullName] einzuführen. Alles was benötigt wird, ist die Unterstützung von Euch und der anderen treuen Vasallen.\n\n Euer [From.Holder.GetTitle]
column6: I have decided to institute the Primogeniture Succession Law in the [From.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals.\n\nYour [From.Holder.GetTitle]

column2: I have decided to institute the Seniority Succession Law in the [From.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals.\n\nYour [From.Holder.GetTitle]
column3: J'ai décidé d'instituer le droit de succession basé sur la Séniorité en [From.GetFullName]. Votre soutien et celui de mes autres fidèles vassaux m'est nécessaire.\n\nVotre [From.Holder.GetTitle]
column4: Ich habe beschlossen, das Primogenitur-Erbrecht in [From.GetFullName] einzuführen. Alles was benötigt wird, ist die Unterstützung von Euch und der anderen treuen Vasallen.\n\n Euer [From.Holder.GetTitle]
column6: I have decided to institute the Seniority Succession Law in the [From.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals.\n\nYour [From.Holder.GetTitle]

column2: The results of the vote on my proposed Succession Law change in the [FromFrom.GetName] are in.
column3: Voici les résultats du vote sur le changement du droit de succession proposé en [FromFrom.GetName]
column4: Die Ergebnisse der Abstimmung über meine geplante Erbrechtsänderung in [FromFrom.GetName] sind gekommen.
column6: The results of the vote on my proposed Succession Law change in the [FromFrom.GetName] are in.

column2: The Succession Law change proposed by [From.GetTitledName] was approved.
column3: Le changement du droit de succession proposé par [From.GetTitledName] a été approuvé.
column4: Die Erbrechtsänderung auf Vorschlag von [From.GetTitledName] wurde gebilligt.
column6: The Succession Law change proposed by [From.GetTitledName] was approved.

column2: The Succession Law change proposed by [From.GetTitledName] was rejected.
column3: Le changement du droit de succession proposé par [From.GetTitledName] a été rejeté.
column4: Die Erbrechtsänderung auf Vorschlag von [From.GetTitledName] wurde abgelehnt.
column6: The Succession Law change proposed by [From.GetTitledName] was rejected.

column2: This year's summer fair was a great success! The merchants and traders drawn to [Root.Capital.GetName] have revitalized the province's economy.
column3: La foire d'été de cette année a été un grand succès! Les marchands et commerçants venus à [Root.Capital.GetName] ont revitalisé l'économie de la province.
column4: Das diesjährige Sommerfest war ein voller Erfolg! Die Kaufleute und Händler zu [Root.Capital.GetName] haben die Wirtschaft der Provinz revitalisiert.
column6: This year's summer fair was a great success! The merchants and traders drawn to [Root.Capital.GetName] have revitalized the province's economy.

column2: I went to [From.GetFirstName]'s chamber and gave [From.GetHerHim] a good tumble!
column3: Je me suis introduit dans la chambre de [From.GetFirstName] et l'ai honorée !
column4: Ich ging zu [From.GetFirstName]'s Kammer und gab [From.GetHerHim] eine gute Nacht!
column6: I went to [From.GetFirstName]'s chamber and gave [From.GetHerHim] a good tumble!

column2: [From.GetFirstName] has spurned my subtle advances.
column3: [From.GetFirstName] a repoussé mes subtiles avances.
column4: [From.GetFirstName] hat meine subtilen Annäherungen verschmäht.
column6: [From.GetFirstName] ha rechazado mis sutiles insinuaciones.

column2: My friends have come up with a daring plan to break me out of prison. Do I dare to make the attempt?
column3: Mes amis sont venus avec un plan audacieux pour me sortir de prison. Oserais-je faire une tentative?
column4: Meine Freunde haben einen mutigen Plan ersonnen, mich aus dem Gefängnis zu befreien. Wage ich, den Versuch ?
column6: My friends have come up with a daring plan to break me out of prison. Do I dare to make the attempt?

column2: I deserve my freedom. I should offer to pay a ransom for my release.
column3: J'ai le droit à la liberté. Je devrais payer une rançon pour me faire relacher.
column4: I deserve my freedom. I should offer to pay a ransom for my release.
column6: I deserve my freedom. I should offer to pay a ransom for my release.

column2: My prisoner, [From.GetBestName], is offering to pay a ransom for [From.GetHerHis] freedom.
column3: Mon prisonnier, [From.GetBestName], m'offre de payer une rançon pour obtenir la liberté.
column4: My prisoner, [From.GetBestName], is offering to pay a ransom for [From.GetHerHis] freedom.
column6: My prisoner, [From.GetBestName], is offering to pay a ransom for [From.GetHerHis] freedom.

column2: I have become strongly attached to the culture of [Root.Capital.GetName], dressing and speaking almost like a local.
column3: Je suis devenu extrêmement attaché à la culture de [Root.Capital.GetName], je m'habille et parle presque comme un local.
column4: Ich habe mich stark der [Root.Capital.GetName]en Kultur angepasst. Fast schon wie ein Einheimischer.
column6: I have become strongly attached to the culture of [Root.Capital.GetName], dressing and speaking almost like a local.

column2: Battle is the best teacher! I have gained knowledge of advanced combat tactics.
column3: La guerre est le meilleur des professeur! J'ai pris connaissance de tactiques de combat avancées.
column4: Schlacht ist der beste Lehrmeister! Ich habe Kenntnisse über fortgeschrittene Kampftaktiken gewonnen.
column6: Battle is the best teacher! I have gained knowledge of advanced combat tactics.

column2: Perhaps it is a miracle - my old injury is beginning to feel a little better.
column3: Peut-être que c'est un miracle - mon ancienne blessure commence à aller un peu mieux.
column4: Vielleicht ist es ein Wunder - meine alte Verletzung beginnt zu heilen und ich fühle mich ein wenig besser.
column6: Tal vez es un milagro - de mi vieja lesión está empezando a sentir un poco mejor.

column2: Peasant rebels have taken control of one of our holdings in [From.GetName] and declared independence!
column3: Les paysans rebelles ont pris le contrôle d'un de vos fiefs en [From.GetName] et ont déclaré leur indépendance !
column4: Bauerrebellen haben die Kontrolle über eines unserer Beteiligungen in [From.GetName] genommen und Unabhängigkeit erklärt!
column6: Peasant rebels have taken control of one of our holdings in [From.GetName] and declared independence!

column2: I was captured during the siege of [From.GetName] by [From.GetTitledName] and am now [From.GetHerHis] prisoner.
column3: J'ai été capturé pendant le siège de [From.GetName] par [From.GetTitledName] et je suis maintenant son prisonnier.
column4: Ich war während der Belagerung von [From.GetName] bei [From.GetTitledName] erfasst und  bin jetzt [From.GetHerHis] Gefangener.
column6: I was captured during the siege of [From.GetName] by [From.GetTitledName] and am now [From.GetHerHis] prisoner.

column2: [From.GetTitledName] was captured during the siege of [FromFrom.GetName] and is now my prisoner.
column3: [From.GetTitledName] a été capturé pendant le siège de [FromFrom.GetName] et est maintenant mon prisonnier.
column4: [From.GetTitledName] wurde während der Belagerung von [FromFrom.GetName] gefangen genommen und ist jetzt mein Gefangener.
column6: [From.GetTitledName] was captured during the siege of [FromFrom.GetName] and is now my prisoner.

column2: I have grown increasingly attached to [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName], and though our marriage was merely a practical arrangement I wonder if I have now come to love [Root.Spouse.GetHerHim].
column3: Je suis de plus en plus attaché à [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName], et bien que notre mariage n'ai été qu'un arrangement pratique je me demande si je n'en suis pas venu à aimer [Root.Spouse.GetHerHim].
column4: Ich fühle mich immer mehr zu [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] hingezogen, und das obwohl unsere Ehre eher zweckmäßig war bisher. Ich frage mich ob ich Liebe gegenüber [Root.Spouse.GetHerHim] empfinde.
column6: I have grown increasingly attached to [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName], and though our marriage was merely a practical arrangement I wonder if I have now come to love [Root.Spouse.GetHerHim].

column2: My wound has become infected and gangrenous. The surgeon says that the limb must be removed if I am to survive.
column3: Ma blessure a commencé à s'infecter et à se gangréner. Le chirugien dit que le membre doit être emputé si je veux survivre.
column4: Meine alte Wunde hat sich mit Wundbrand infiziert. Der Chirurg meint, dass er die Gliedmaße amputieren muss, wenn ich überleben will.
column6: My wound has become infected and gangrenous. The surgeon says that the limb must be removed if I am to survive.

column2: The illness sent me into a deep sleep in which I spent days moaning and trashing about in my fevered delirium. When I woke, the fever had broken but the world had gone dark.
column3: La maladie m'a plongé dans un profond sommeil et j'ai passé des journées à gémir dans mon délire fiévreux. Lorsque je me suis réveillé, la fièvre avait disparu, mais le monde était devenu sombre.
column4: The illness sent me into a deep sleep in which I spent days moaning and trashing about in my fevered delirium. When I woke, the fever had broken but the world had gone dark.
column6: The illness sent me into a deep sleep in which I spent days moaning and trashing about in my fevered delirium. When I woke, the fever had broken but the world had gone dark.

column2: A Thieves' Guild has been established in [Root.GetName].
column3: Mon inaptitude pour l’intendance a entraîné l’établissement d’une Guilde de voleurs à [Root.GetName].
column4: Aufgrund meiner etwas hapernden Verwaltungsfähigkeit hat sich in [Root.GetName] eine Diebesgilde eingerichtet.
column6: Debido a mi incapacidad administrativa se ha establecido una banda de ladrones en [Root.GetName].

column2: Thanks to my tireless efforts, the Thieves' Guild in [Root.GetName] has been eradicated.
column3: Grâce à mes compétences en matière d’intendance, la Guilde de voleurs de [Root.GetName] a été éradiquée.
column4: Dank meiner klugen Verwaltung von [Root.GetName] wurde die hiesige Diebesgilde ausgerottet.
column6: Gracias a mi buena administración de [Root.GetName], la banda de ladrones ha sido eliminada.

column2: A Smugglers' Ring has formed in [Root.GetName].
column3: Mes piètres talents de diplomate ont permis à un Cercle de contrebandiers de se créer à [Root.GetName].
column4: Meine mangelnde Diplomatiefähigkeit hat in [Root.GetName] zum Aufkommen eines Schmugglerrings geführt.
column6: Debido a mi escasa diplomacia ha surgido una red de contrabandistas en [Root.GetName].

column2: Thanks to my tireless efforts, the Smugglers' Ring in [Root.GetName] has been destroyed. The head of the last smuggler is now rotting on a pike outside the city gates.
column3: Grâce à mes grandes compétences diplomatiques, le Cercle de contrebandiers de [Root.GetName] a été éradiqué. La tête du dernier contrebandier pourrit désormais au bout d’une pique devant les portes de la cité.
column4: Dank meiner großartigen Diplomatiefähigkeit wurde der Schmugglerring in [Root.GetName] vernichtet. Der Kopf des letzten Schmugglers verrottet nun auf einem Spieß vor den Stadttoren.
column6: Gracias a mi habilidad diplomática, la red de contrabandistas de [Root.GetName] ha sido destruida. El jefe del último contrabandista se pudre ahora empalado en una pica fuera de la villa.

column2: Bands of robbers are roaming the countryside in [Root.GetName], killing and stealing. They are too craven to attack my castles though.
column3: À cause de mon manque de discernement dans le domaine martial, des bandes de voleurs sillonnent les campagnes de [Root.GetName]. Ils sont cependant trop lâches pour attaquer mes châteaux.
column4: Aufgrund meiner mittelmäßigen Fähigkeiten in der Kriegskunst ziehen nun in [Root.GetName] Räuberbanden umher. Zum Angriff auf meine Burgen sind sie aber zu feige.
column6: Debido a mis escasos conocimientos militares, bandas de ladrones vagan por los campos de [Root.GetName]. Aunque son demasiado cobardes para atacar mis castillos.

column2: I have rounded up and executed the robber bands that were plaguing [Root.GetName]!
column3: Grâce à mes grandes compétences martiales, j’ai fait arrêter et exécuter les bandes de voleurs qui sévissaient à [Root.GetName] !
column4: Dank meiner großartigen Kriegskunstfähigkeit konnte ich die [Root.GetName] heimsuchenden Räuberbanden zusammentreiben und hinrichten!
column6: ¡Con mi gran habilidad militar he acorralado y ejecutado a las bandas de ladrones que plagaban [Root.GetName]!

column2: The Jewish Community that I am sheltering has prospered and grown under my benevolent rule.
column3: La communauté juive que je protège a grandi et prospéré sous mon règne bienveillant.
column4: Die Jüdische Gemeinde, die unter Eurem Schutz steht, hat sich entwickelt und wuchs unter Eurer wohlwollenden Herrschaft.
column6: The Jewish Community that I am sheltering has prospered and grown under my benevolent rule.

column2: My liege, I bring news from the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. The Jewish merchants that you wisely allowed to settle in the city have grown fat and prosperous under your benevolent rule, and you can expect increased revenue from the taxes and tariffs imposed on their community.
column3: Mon seigneur, je vous apporte des nouvelles de l'[From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. Les marchands juifs que vous avez sagement autorisés à s'installer dans la ville se sont developpés et prospèrent sous votre règne bienveillant. Vous pouvez vous attendre à une augmentation des revenus provenant des taxes et droits de douane imposés sur leur communauté.
column4: My liege, I bring news from the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. The Jewish merchants that you wisely allowed to settle in the city have grown fat and prosperous under your benevolent rule, and you can expect increased revenue from the taxes and tariffs imposed on their community.
column6: My liege, I bring news from the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. The Jewish merchants that you wisely allowed to settle in the city have grown fat and prosperous under your benevolent rule, and you can expect increased revenue from the taxes and tariffs imposed on their community.

column2: A skilled advisor from the Jewish Community I am sheltering has made his services available to me.
column3: Un conseiller qualifié de la communauté juive que j'abrite, a mis ses services à ma disposition.
column4: Ein talentierter Berater aus der Jüdischen Gemeinde bietet Euch seine Dienste an.
column6: A skilled advisor from the Jewish Community I am sheltering has made his services available to me.

column2: A group of Jewish refugees from distant lands have come to my court. They are seeking a new a place to live after being expelled from their former homes and ask for my permission to establish a community in one of my cities.
column3: Un groupe de réfugiés juifs d'un pays lointain est venu à ma cour. Ils sont à la recherche d'un nouveau lieu de vie après avoir été expulsés de leurs anciens foyers et me demandent la permission d'établir une communauté dans une de mes villes.
column4: Eine Gruppe jüdischer Flüchtlinge aus fernen Landen kam an euren Hof. Sie sind auf der Suche nach einem neuen Ort zum Leben, nachdem sie aus ihrer Heimat vertrieben wurden. Nun bitten sie um Erlaubnis, sich in einer Eurer Städte niederzulassen und eine neue Gemeinde zu gründen.
column6: A group of Jewish refugees from distant lands have come to my court. They are seeking a new a place to live after being expelled from their former homes and ask for my permission to establish a community in one of my cities.

column2: [From.GetTitledName] has decreed that all Jews in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are to be expelled from the realm and their assets seized by the crown. This includes my own Jewish subjects, who I have no choice but to banish unless I want to openly defy my liege.
column3: [From.GetTitledName] a décrété que tous les Juifs [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] doivent être expulsés du royaume et leurs biens saisis par la couronne. Cela comprend mes propres sujets juifs, je n'ai pas d'autre choix que de les bannir à moins que je tiennes à défier ouvertement mon suzerain.
column4: [From.GetTitledName] hat angeordnet, dass alle Juden aus [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] vertrieben werden sollen und ihr Besitz an die Krone fällt. Das betrifft auch Eure jüdischen Untertanen - und Ihr habt keine andere Wahl, falls Ihr nicht Euren eigenen Besitz verlieren wollt.
column6: [From.GetTitledName] has decreed that all Jews in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are to be expelled from the realm and their assets seized by the crown. This includes my own Jewish subjects, who I have no choice but to banish unless I want to openly defy my liege.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] believed me when I told [From.GetHerHim] I had never even talked to the girl who accused me of raping her.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] m'a cru lorsque j'ai dit [From.GetHerHim] je n'ai jamais parlé à la fille qui m'a accusé de l'avoir violé.
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName] glaubte mir als ich [From.GetHerHim] erzählte, das ich nie mit der Frau gesprochen habe, die mich der Vergewaltigung beschuldigt hat.
column6: [From.GetTitledFirstName] believed me when I told [From.GetHerHim] I had never even talked to the girl who accused me of raping her.

column2: I have completed my education.
column3: J'ai terminé mes études.
column4: Ich habe meine Ausbildung beendet.
column6: I have completed my education.

column2: I am now of legal age.
column3: Je suis maintenant majeur.
column4: Ich bin nun erwachsen.
column6: I am now of legal age.

column2: My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] is now of legal age.
column3: Mon [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] est maintenant adulte.
column4: Mein/e [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] ist nun erwachsen.
column6: My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] is now of legal age.

column2: The Bulgarian state has finally perished by your hands and their 'empire' has collapsed into ruins. The conflict that has lasted decades is over and we can rejoice that our northern borders are safe once more and our control of the Balkans is undisputed. For this achievement you are going to be known for at least another millennium.
column3: The Bulgarian state has finally perished by your hands and their 'empire' has collapsed into ruins. The conflict that has lasted decades is over and we can rejoice that our northern borders are safe once more and our control of the Balkans is undisputed. For this achievement you are going to be known for at least another millennium.
column4: The Bulgarian state has finally perished by your hands and their 'empire' has collapsed into ruins. The conflict that has lasted decades is over and we can rejoice that our northern borders are safe once more and our control of the Balkans is undisputed. For this achievement you are going to be known for at least another millennium.
column6: The Bulgarian state has finally perished by your hands and their 'empire' has collapsed into ruins. The conflict that has lasted decades is over and we can rejoice that our northern borders are safe once more and our control of the Balkans is undisputed. For this achievement you are going to be known for at least another millennium.

column2: My lord, nothing less than a miracle has occurred We have repelled the full scale Byzantine invasion and our Empire is safe once more. But discontent is growing in the Roman lands and the position of the Basileus is balancing on the edge. Maybe we could benefit from that?
column3: My lord, nothing less than a miracle has occured. We have repelled the full scale Byzantine invasion and our Empire is safe once more. But discontent is growing in the Roman lands and the position of the Basileus is balancing on the edge. Maybe we could benefit from that?
column4: My lord, nothing less than a miracle has occured. We have repelled the full scale Byzantine invasion and our Empire is safe once more. But discontent is growing in the Roman lands and the position of the Basileus is balancing on the edge. Maybe we could benefit from that?
column6: My lord, nothing less than a miracle has occured. We have repelled the full scale Byzantine invasion and our Empire is safe once more. But discontent is growing in the Roman lands and the position of the Basileus is balancing on the edge. Maybe we could benefit from that?

column2: Your Grace, the vile Polish have taken the Moravian territories from us and in their naivity they think they could claim the Duchy of Bohemia as well! Of course we could defeat them single-handedly, the problem is that they are a little bit more powerful at the moment and so we should probably resort to some more cunning tactics...
column3: Your Grace, the vile Polish have taken the Moravian territories from us and in their naivity they think they could claim the Duchy of Bohemia as well! Of course we could defeat them single-handedly, the problem is that they are a little bit more powerful at the moment and so we should probably resort to some more cunning tactics...
column4: Your Grace, the vile Polish have taken the Moravian territories from us and in their naivity they think they could claim the Duchy of Bohemia as well! Of course we could defeat them single-handedly, the problem is that they are a little bit more powerful at the moment and so we should probably resort to some more cunning tactics...
column6: Your Grace, the vile Polish have taken the Moravian territories from us and in their naivity they think they could claim the Duchy of Bohemia as well! Of course we could defeat them single-handedly, the problem is that they are a little bit more powerful at the moment and so we should probably resort to some more cunning tactics...

column2: Tughril-Beg, the leader of the Turkish tribes who conquered Persia, has taken the City of Baghdad and proclaimed himself the ruler of the Great Seljuk Empire.
column3: Tughril-Beg, the leader of the Turkish tribes who conquered Persia, has taken the City of Baghdad and proclaimed himself the ruler of the Great Seljuk Empire.
column4: Tughril-Beg, the leader of the Turkish tribes who conquered Persia, has taken the City of Baghdad and proclaimed himself the ruler of the Great Seljuk Empire.
column6: Tughril-Beg, the leader of the Turkish tribes who conquered Persia, has taken the City of Baghdad and proclaimed himself the ruler of the Great Seljuk Empire.

column2: The old Anglo-Saxon kingdom of England will now be forfeit…but do not despair! From its ashes a much more powerful and glorious realm will arise!
column3: The old Anglo-Saxon kingdom of England will now be forfeit…but do not despair! From its ashes a much more powerful and glorious realm will arise!
column4: The old Anglo-Saxon kingdom of England will now be forfeit…but do not despair! From its ashes a much more powerful and glorious realm will arise!
column6: The old Anglo-Saxon kingdom of England will now be forfeit…but do not despair! From its ashes a much more powerful and glorious realm will arise!

column2: Your Majesty, a Christian monk by the name of Sigfrid has arrived from the Catholic churches of Västergotland. He would like to preach at Your court and show You the benefits of Christianity.
column3: Your Majesty, a Christian monk by the name of Sigfrid has arrived from the Catholic churches of Västergotland. He would like to preach at Your court and show You the benefits of Christianity.
column4: Your Majesty, a Christian monk by the name of Sigfrid has arrived from the Catholic churches of Västergotland. He would like to preach at Your court and show You the benefits of Christianity.
column6: Your Majesty, a Christian monk by the name of Sigfrid has arrived from the Catholic churches of Västergotland. He would like to preach at Your court and show You the benefits of Christianity.

column2: Sigfrid has continued preaching his religion in our capital, and he seems to be gathering a larger and larger audience. After listening to one of his sermons, you have to admit that the new faith may have some advantages...
column3: Sigfrid has continued preaching his religion in our capital, and he seems to be gathering a larger and larger audience. After listening to one of his sermons, you have to admit that the new faith may have some advantages...
column4: Sigfrid has continued preaching his religion in our capital, and he seems to be gathering a larger and larger audience. After listening to one of his sermons, you have to admit that the new faith may have some advantages...
column6: Sigfrid has continued preaching his religion in our capital, and he seems to be gathering a larger and larger audience. After listening to one of his sermons, you have to admit that the new faith may have some advantages...

column2: The Pagan King of Sweden has decided to be baptized by Siegfried of Glastonbury and converted to Christianity. It looks like that the era of the Old Gods is over.
column3: The Pagan King of Sweden has decided to be baptized by Siegfried of Glastonbury and converted to Christianity. It looks like that the era of the Old Gods is over.
column4: The Pagan King of Sweden has decided to be baptized by Siegfried of Glastonbury and converted to Christianity. It looks like that the era of the Old Gods is over.
column6: The Pagan King of Sweden has decided to be baptized by Siegfried of Glastonbury and converted to Christianity. It looks like that the era of the Old Gods is over.

column2: After years of careful planning, Olaf Haraldsson, the last male descendant of Harald Fairhair has raised a large army of exiles, mercenaries and hopefuls, declaring intention to retake the Crown of Norway by force.
column3: After years of careful planning, Olaf Haraldsson, the last male descendant of Harald Fairhair has raised a large army of exiles, mercenaries and hopefuls, declaring intention to retake the Crown of Norway by force.
column4: After years of careful planning, Olaf Haraldsson, the last male descendant of Harald Fairhair has raised a large army of exiles, mercenaries and hopefuls, declaring intention to retake the Crown of Norway by force.
column6: After years of careful planning, Olaf Haraldsson, the last male descendant of Harald Fairhair has raised a large army of exiles, mercenaries and hopefuls, declaring intention to retake the Crown of Norway by force.

column2: My King! The dreadful Norse ruler of Denmark, vile Sweyn Forkbeard has finished consolidating his gains in Norway and now he has stated that he is going to invade England as many Vikings have done before…
column3: My King! The dreadful Norse ruler of Denmark, vile Sweyn Forkbeard has finished consolidating his gains in Norway and now he has stated that he is going to invade England as many Vikings have done before…

column2: A messenger has arrived from Iberia - the last remnants of the Caliphate of Córdoba has been destroyed. It was the last bastion of the Umayyad Empire, the greatest Muslim realm the world has ever seen.
column3: A messenger has arrived from Iberia - the last remnants of the Caliphate of Córdoba has been destroyed. It was the last bastion of the Umayyad Empire, the greatest Muslim realm the world has ever seen.

column2: A messenger has arrived from Egypt - the last remnants of the Caliphate of Cairo, an Empire created by the Fatimids has fallen to obscurity.
column3: A messenger has arrived from Egypt - the last remnants of the Caliphate of Cairo, an Empire created by the Fatimids has fallen to obscurity.
column4: A messenger has arrived from Egypt - the last remnants of the Caliphate of Cairo, an Empire created by the Fatimids has fallen to obscurity.
column6: A messenger has arrived from Egypt - the last remnants of the Caliphate of Cairo, an Empire created by the Fatimids has fallen to obscurity.

column2: It took all my skill and charm to sow distrust between the local ruler and his vassals, but at last their relations lay in ruins.
column3: Il a fallu tout mon charme et mon savoir-faire pour semer la discorde entre le souverain local et ses vassaux, mais finalement j'ai réussi et maintenant leurs relations sont très tendues.
column4: Es nahm alle meine Geschicklichkeit und Charme um Misstrauen zwischen der lokalen Herrscher und seine Vasallen zu säen, aber endlich legen ihre Beziehungen in Trümmern.
column6: It took all my skill and charm to sow distrust between the local ruler and his vassals, but at last their relations lay in ruins.

column2: I fear that the long years of peace have made me complacent and decadent. Where once I would long for the sounds of battle and the glory of victory, I now prefer the comfortable, easy life of luxury in my palaces.
column3: Je crains que les longues années de paix ont fait de moi la complaisance et la décadence incarnée. Là où jadis je vivais pour la gloire et le feu des batailles , je préfère maintenant la vie confortable de mes palais.
column4: Ich fürchte, dass die langen Jahre des Friedens haben mich selbstgefällig und dekaden gemachtt. Wo einst würde ich mich nach den Geräusche des Kampfes und der Ruhm des Sieges sehnen, habe ich jetzt lieber den bequemen, einfachen Leben von Luxus meiner Paläste.
column6: I fear that the long years of peace have made me complacent and decadent. Where once I would long for the sounds of battle and the glory of victory, I now prefer the comfortable, easy life of luxury in my palaces.

column2: [From.GetBestName] was captured after the siege and is now my prisoner!

column4: [From.GetBestName] wurde in der Schlacht gefangengenommen und ist nun mein Gefangener!
column6: ¡[From.GetBestName] fue capturado en combate y ahora es mi prisionero!

column2: The forces you ordered to assemble are now ready to invade the Kingdom of England. We shall teach the Anglo-Saxons a lesson they will not forget!
column3: The forces you ordered to assemble are now ready to invade the Kingdom of England. We shall teach the Anglo-Saxons a lesson they will not forget!

column2: Just as I thought I had made it to freedom, a group of armed men appear under the banner of my foe.  Exhausted from my escape, it is all I can do to croak the word 'yield.'
column3: Just as I thought I had made it to freedom, a group of armed men appear under the banner of my foe.  Exhausted from my escape, it is all I can do to croak the word 'yield.'

column2: My Lord, we've caught the enemy commander sneaking out the castle!
column3: My Lord, we've caught the enemy commander sneaking out the castle!
column4: My Lord, we've caught the enemy commander sneaking out the castle!
column6: My Lord, we've caught the enemy commander sneaking out the castle!

column2: In the dead of night, as a low mist hung about the curtain wall, you creep out a postern door and float across the moat on an inflated sheepskin.  It's only by the ineptitude of the enemy watch that you stagger, dripping wet, through the siege lines and to the safety of a nearby wood.  Thanks be to God! ... Although any family left behind is likely angry with us...

Although any family left behind is likely angry with us...

column2: Your steward leads you down into the store rooms to a passage you didn't even know existed.  Beyond it, a dismal tunnel full of death and decay, and you are only too glad to reach the moat and relatively fresh water. I hope I never have to do that again!  It only now occurs to me that any family left behind is likely angry with me for leaving them in the hands of the enemy.

column2: They said only a lunatic would attempt climbing down the southeast wall, and certainly the enemy agreed!  A near thing, too, when my foot slipped on that patch of moss.  My brush with death over with, and safety assured, it only now occurs to me that any family left behind will see this as a desertion, not a bold deed of heroism...

column2: Harkening back to the early days of Islam, the Ansar have adopted the name given to Muhammad's first allies in Medina, who helped the Prophet's companions in the war against the Quraysh. Like the original Ansar, the new holy warriors will assist the leaders of orthodox Islam in spreading the religion of God, by sword if need be.
column3: Une secte soufie de derviches est apparue sous le commandement d'un certain Haci Bektas Veli, un mystique natif du Khorassan. Œuvrant pour ce qu'ils appellent l'Unité de l'Être, les Bektachis forment leurs âmes à la méditation et la contemplation du sens caché du Coran. La Confrérie des Bektachis est un ordre guerrier particulièrement apprécié des soldats musulmans [Root.Religion.GetName]. L'ordre a juré de protéger l'Islam et de combattre les infidèles et les polythéistes de toutes sortes.
column4: Unter der Führerschaft eines gewissen Hadschi Baktasch Wali, eines Mystikers aus Khorosan, ist eine Sufi-Sekte aus Derwischen entstanden. In ihrem Streben nach der "Einheit des Seins" ertüchtigen die Bektaschis ihre Seele durch Meditation und Kontemplation der wahren Bedeutung des Korans. Der kriegerische Bektaschi-Orden ist besonders bei jungen [Root.Religion.GetName] Soldaten beliebt. Die Mitglieder leisten einen Eid, den Islam zu schützen und Ungläubige und Polytheisten jeder Art zu belämpfen.
column6: Ha surgido una secta sufí de derviches bajo el liderazgo de un tal Hadji Bektash Wali, un místico de Jorasán. Los Bektashis aspiran a la "Unidad del Ser” y educan el alma a través de la meditación y la contemplación del significado interno del Corán. La Orden Bektashi es favorable a la guerra y especialmente popular entre los soldados musulmanes [Root.Religion.GetName]. La Orden ha jurado proteger el Islam y combatir a los infieles y politeístas de todo tipo.

column2: Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], of course we, the Ansar, can lend you 300 gold. All that we ask in return is your future assistance in certain matters as they might arise. Salaam alaykum,\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]
column3: Très vertueux [Root.GetTitledFirstName], la Confrérie des Bektachis peut bien évidemment vous prêter 300 or. La chose que nous demandons en contrepartie est votre aide future lorsque certains besoins se feront sentir. As-salâm 'aleïkoum,\n\nGrand Maître [From.GetFirstName]
column4: Hochwohlgeborener [Root.GetTitledFirstName], natürlich können wir, der Bektaschi-Orden, Euch 300 Gold leihen. Als Gegenleistung erbitten wir lediglich Eure Unterstützung in gewissen Angelegenheiten, die sich ergeben könnten. Salaam alaykum,\n\nGroßmeister [From.GetFirstName]
column6: Mi justo [Root.GetTitledFirstName], por supuesto que nosotros, la Orden Bektashi, podemos prestarle 300 oros. Todo lo que pedimos a cambio es su futura asistencia en determinados asuntos que puedan surgir. Salaam alaykum,\n\nGran Maestre [From.GetFirstName]

column2: The Ansar have constructed a castle in [Root.GetName]!
column3: La Confrérie des Bektachis a édifié un château en [Root.GetName] !
column4: Der Bektaschi-Orden hat in [Root.GetName] eine Burg errichtet!
column6: ¡La Orden Bektashi ha construido un castillo en [Root.GetName]!

column2: My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has requested to join the Ansar to fight the infidel! This will forever disinherit him and he will never disgrace the dynasty with his decadence.
column3: Mon [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], a demandé à rejoindre les Bektachis dans leur lutte contre les infidèles ! Cela le déshéritera à jamais mais il ne déshonorera jamais la dynastie par sa décadence !
column4: Mein [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName] will dem Bektaschi-Orden beitreten, um gegen die Ungläubigen zu kämpfen! Das wird ihn auf ewig von der Erbfolge ausschließen und er wird niemals durch seine Dekadenz der Dynastie Schande bereiten.
column6: ¡Mi [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] ha solicitado unirse a la Orden Bektashi para combatir a los infieles! Esta acción le desheredará para siempre y su decadencia no traerá nunca la desgracia a esta dinastía.

column2: The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Norse culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Icelandic.
column3: Le peuple de [Root.GetName] a développé sa langue et ses coutumes à un point tel qu'il est maintenant considéré comme une branche distincte de la culture nordique. Ses gens ont commencé à se définir en tant que Norvégiens.
column4: Die Menschen von [Root.GetName] haben ihre Kultur und Sprache soweit entwickelt, dass sie nun als eigener Zweig der nordischen Kultur betrachtet werden können. Sie haben begonnen, sich selbst als Norweger zu bezeichnen.
column6: Los habitantes de [Root.GetName] han desarrollado su idioma y sus costumbres hasta el punto en que ahora pueden ser considerados parte de una rama distinta de la cultura Nórdica. Han comenzado a referirse a sí mismos como Noruegos.

column2: Varangian raiders sailing from the distant north down the rivers leading into the Black Sea have proven themselves to be formidable warriors. You have managed to recruit a great many of their number into a personal guard loyal only to the [Root.GetTitle].\n\nThis new Varangian Guard will not only form a powerful shock force against the Empire's many enemies, but their foreign roots should also preclude them from becoming too entangled in the palace intrigue and power struggles that are so commonplace in the court.
column3: Les pillards varègues qui, depuis le nord lointain, voguent sur les fleuves qui se jettent dans la mer Noire, ont prouvé qu'ils étaient de redoutables guerriers. Vous avez réussi à recruter un grand nombre d'entre eux pour monter une garde personnelle de soldats totalement loyaux envers leur [Root.GetTitle].\n\nL'avantage de cette nouvelle Garde varègue est non seulement de former une puissante force de frappe contre les nombreux ennemis de l'empire, mais aussi d'être détachée, par ses racines étrangères, des complots et des jeux de pouvoir qui ont lieu au palais et qui sont monnaie courante à Constantinople.
column4: Warägerräuber, die aus dem fernen Norden die Flüsse bis zum Schwarzen Meer segelten, haben sich als herausragende Krieger erwiesen. Euch ist es gelungen, eine große Anzahl von ihnen als Leibwache zu rekrutieren, die nur gegenüber dem [Root.GetTitle] loyal ist.\n\n Diese neue Warägergarde stellt nicht nur eine mächtige Stoßtruppe dar, ihre ausländische Herkunft sollte auch sicherstellen, dass sie nicht allzu sehr in die Intrigen und Machtspiele verwickelt werden, die so typisch für Konstantinopel sind.
column6: Los invasores Varangianos navegando desde el lejano norte por los ríos que llevan al Mar Negro han demostrado ser guerreros formidables. Tú has logrado reclutar un gran número de ellos para una guardia personal leal sólo al [Root.GetTitle].\n\nEsta nueva Guardia Varangiana no sólo formará una gran fuerza contra los muchos enemigos del Imperio, sino que también sus raíces extranjeras impedirán que se enreden demasiado en la intriga palaciega y las luchas de poder que son tan comunes en Constantinopla.

column2: [From.GetFirstName] is distraught over the poor mettle of his countrymen. Knowing well our skill in battle, he has decided to form a bodyguard consisting solely of Norse warriors.\n\nThose who serve him in the great city of Miklagård are generously rewarded, and even now many of our young men, eager for riches and adventure, have departed for Greece to pick up his banner.
column3: [From.GetFirstName] est angoissé par le peu de courage de ses compatriotes. Connaissant bien notre aptitude au combat, il a décidé de composer son équipe de gardes du corps uniquement de guerriers nordiques.\n\nCeux qui le servent dans la grande cité de Miklagård sont généreusement récompensés et, aujourd'hui encore, les jeunes hommes avides de richesse et d'aventure quittent pour la Grèce afin de le servir.
column4: [From.GetFirstName] ist bestürzt über den lausigen Eifer seiner Landsmänner. Euren Kampfesmut kennend, hat er beschlossen, eine Leibwache nur aus nordischen Kriegern aufzustellen.\n\nWer ihm in Miklagard dient, wird reich belohnt und viele Eurer jungen Männer, erpicht auf Gold und Abenteuer, sind nach Griechenland abgereist, um in seinen Dienst zu treten.
column6: [From.GetFirstName] está perturbado por el poco ánimo de sus compatriotas. Conociendo bien nuestra habilidad en la batalla, ha decidido formar una guardia que consiste únicamente de guerreros Nórdicos.\n\nAquellos que le sirven en la gran ciudad de Miklagård son generosamente recompensados, e incluso ahora muchos de nuestros jóvenes, ávidos de riquezas y aventura, han partido hacia Grecia para levantar su estandarte.

column2: I will not be blackmailed
column3: Je ne vais pas céder au chantage
column4: I will not be blackmailed

column2:
Your shameful attempt at blackmail has not succeeded. No matter how many corrupted souls you have enticed to help carry out your plan I will not give in without a fight. I'd rather die defending what is rightfully mine!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
Votre tentative de chantage honteux n'a pas réussi. Peu importe combien d'âmes corrompues vous ont aidé à réaliser votre stratagème, je ne céderai pas sans combattre. Je préfère mourir en défendant ce qui est légitimement mien! 

Signé,
[From.GetTitledName]
column4:

column2: The Great Schism saw the Christian Church divided into two branches, but if all five of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy could be restored under our rule to the Catholic faith, there may be a chance to finally reunite Christendom.
column3: L'Église chrétienne s'est vu divisée en deux lignées par le Grand Schisme, mais si la totalité des cinq sièges épiscopaux de la Pentarchie peuvent être rétablis sous le règne de Rome et de la foi orthodoxe, il y a peut-être une chance de réunir enfin la C
column4: Das Große Schisma sah die christliche Kirche in zwei Teile zerfallen, doch wenn alle fünf episkopalen Arme der Pentarchie wieder unter römischer Herrschaft und in orthodoxem Glauben vereint sind, besteht eine Chance, das Christentum wieder zu vereinen.
column6: El Gran Cisma dividió la Iglesia Cristiana en dos ramas, pero si las cinco sedes episcopales de la Pentarquía pueden ser recuperadas bajo el dominio romano y la fe ortodoxa, podría haber una oportunidad de reunir finalmente la cristiandad.
